description: An example dashboard for Longhorn v1.1.0

panels.description: The total number of volumes in the Longhorn storage system
panels.title: Total Number Of Volumes

panels.description: Healthy volumes are volumes that are attaching to a node and have the number of healthy replicas equals to the expected number of replicas.
panels.title: Number Of Healthy Volumes

panels.description: Note that Longhorn volume actual size is not the size of the filesystem inside a Longhorn volume.  See more at : https://longhorn.io/docs/1.0.2/volumes-and-nodes/volume-size/#volume-actual-size
panels.title: Volume Actual Size/Capacity

panels.description: Degraded volumes are volumes that have the number of healthy replicas smaller than the expected number of replicas. e.g. User creates a volume with 2 replicas but 1 replicas is failed.
panels.title: Number Of Degraded Volumes

panels.description: Fault volumes are volumes that doesn't have any healthy replica.
panels.title: Number Of Fault Volumes

panels.description: The capacity of each Longhorn volume
panels.title: Volume Capacity

panels.description: Attached volumes are volumes that are currently attaching to a node
panels.title: Number Of Attached Volumes

panels.description: Detached volumes are volumes that aren't currently attaching to a node
panels.title: Number Of Detached Volumes

panels.description: The total number of nodes in the Longhorn storage system
panels.title: Total Number Of Nodes

panels.description: Disabled nodes are nodes that are disabled by the user.  When users disable a node, Longhorn will not use the node's storage for replica scheduling. Note that Longhorn can still attach a volume to disabled nodes because the actual data of the volume could be on a different node.
panels.title: Number Of Disabled Nodes

panels.description: Schedulable nodes are nodes that Longhorn can use their storage for replica scheduling.

targets.expr: (count(longhorn_node_status{condition="schedulable"}==1) OR on() vector(0)) - (count(longhorn_node_status{condition="allowScheduling"}==0) OR on() vector(0))

panels.title: Number Of Schedulable Nodes

panels.description: Failed Nodes are nodes that Longhorn cannot attach volumes to and cannot schedule replicas onto. e.g: when the nodes went down.

targets.expr: (avg(longhorn_node_count_total) OR on() vector(0)) - (count(longhorn_node_status{condition="ready"}==1) OR on() vector(0))

panels.title: Number Of Failed Nodes

panels.description: The capacity of each Longhorn volume
panels.title: Disk Space Usage

panels.description: Instance managers are pods that contains the engine and replica processes of Longhorn volumes. See more at https://longhorn.io/docs/1.0.2/concepts/#11-the-longhorn-manager-and-the-longhorn-engine
panels.title: Instance Manager CPU Usage

panels.description: Instance managers are pods that contains the engine and replica processes of Longhorn volumes. See more at https://longhorn.io/docs/1.0.2/concepts/#11-the-longhorn-manager-and-the-longhorn-engine
panels.title: Instance Manager CPU Usage/Request

panels.description: Instance managers are pods that contains the engine and replica processes of Longhorn volumes. See more at https://longhorn.io/docs/1.0.2/concepts/#11-the-longhorn-manager-and-the-longhorn-engine
panels.title: Instance Manager Memory Usage

panels.description: Longhorn manager pods manage the control plane of the Longhorn system. e.g. Volume scheduling, attaching, detaching, backup, etc,..
panels.title: Longhorn Manager CPU Usage

panels.description: Longhorn manager pods manage the control plane of the Longhorn system. e.g. Volume scheduling, attaching, detaching, backup, etc,..
panels.title: Longhorn Manager Memory Usage

title: Longhorn
